answers.answer: Hi, inderal is a beta blocker and is mainly given to control palpitations. The symptoms mentioned could be caused by cervical spondylosis. Some metabolic disorders like diabetes mellitus and thyroid disorders are known to simulate these symptoms. Please consult your primary care physician who will carry out blood tests and x rays to rule out these conditions. You seem to be very anxious and in pain, take OTC pain medications like Tylenol (acetaminophen) or ibuprofen. Try applying local analgesic creams. Place ice over the painful area every 1-2hrs for pain relief. Practice relaxation techniques like yoga and meditation. Regards.

Hello  Dr. Anitha,Thanks for the suggestion and in addition I would like to give complete prescribed details. Yes, I have been done with blood tests initially itself. All the reports for the causes, i.e, diabetic as well thyroid all are normal also done with X-ray which is absolutely normal. when I have approached doctor again he suggested to use Trptomer for 10 days but still pain,I finished with 6 days of duration.Though in medication pain in chest, i can see green nerves all over area which is paining. I would like to talk more about this, Is there is anyway to contact you.Please suggest me best.Regards,Salma.

question: I took inderal 10 as prescribed by doctor for rise in heart beat. I used it for a month & not regular basis some time used to skip as per pain in persists. and stopped using after a month as  der is no pain after. few days i was ok... but now its pain in chest when i wake up in morning feel like my heart is pressed in rib cage.. as on neck and pain on back of head......  whwn i have consulted doctor again he gave tablets for pain and vitamin D tablets bt still pain persists...   Can you please suggest me to get rid of pain.....
title: how to get rid if chest pain?
